loans.name: Marta Candelaria

texts.es:
Marta,  vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 11 y 13 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. Ella, posee una tienda de productos básicos del hogar, oficio que lo aprendió  por herencia de su madre y lo desempeña de 6:00am a 7:00pm, lo realiza desde hace 10 años.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar granos básicos tales como: maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sardinas, papel higiénico, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su inventario y a obtener una mejor rentabilidad. 
Su sueño es brindarles educación universitaria a sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida; asimismo ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta lives with her spouse and her two children, who are 11 and 13 years old. She has no family outside the country. She has a shop selling basic household goods, a trade she inherited from her mother. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m., and has done so for the past 10 years. 

The loan she is requesting will permit her to purchase basic goods such as corn, beans, rice, sugar, sardines, toilet paper, and others; this investment will help her build her inventory and improve her profitability. 

Her dream is to give her children a university education and provide them with a better quality of life; and at the same time, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice, sugar, sardines, toilet paper, and other products

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en:
Hrachya is 25 years old and he lives in the village of Ddmashen, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Hrachya’s family in not big; he lives with his mother and his brother. His father passed away several years ago and since then, both Hrachya and his brother are doing their best to take care of their mother properly. 

Hrachya’s brother is a student and simultaneously he works at the rescue service. Hrachya has no higher education and he has never worked anywhere, and since his father died he has become fully engaged in farming and agriculture. His mother helps him very much in farming and potato cultivation. They keep in their farm two cows, two heifers, eight sheep, three piglets and thirty chickens. The meat and the milk of their farm animals they manage to sell through the re-sellers right from their house. 

When Hrachya was still a little boy, he used to think that without his father he could do nothing in this life, but now he understands that he is responsible for his family. Life is going on and he must work as hard as he can to provide better living conditions for his mother and his brother.

Hrachya has taken loans from Nor Horizon already three times and this time he decided to have a deal with Kiva lenders. He asks a loan to buy two cows and a lot of animal fodder in order to provide his farm animals and support his family financially.

loans.use: To buy two cows and a lot of animal fodder in order to provide for his farm animals and support his family financially.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. 

She owns a bar and has been in the business for the past one year. She sells various types of beer and sodas in the bar.

She wants the loan to buy more sodas and beers for resale. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers for sale.

loans.name: Mayimuna

texts.en:
Mayimuna is 32 years old. She has four children, aged between 3 and 13. 

She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the five years. She wants the loan to buy more carrots, eggplants and green beans for resale. She plans to use the profits for renovating the house as well as providing food for her children.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, eggplants and green beans for sale.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana tiene 23 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Diana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y soya, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, urea.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Realiza las compras uy las ventas las realiza en San Juan y en Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar terreno para sembrar màs y obtener mejores utilizades. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero y la competencia.
En el tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Diana is 23 years old.  She is single and she has three children.  She lives with her children in the Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province.  The Cevallos Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco which belongs to the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish.  The members work in agriculture.

Diana works in agriculture planting corn and soy.  She also works raising animals like chickens and pigs.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, herbicides, fertilizers and urea.  With the support of the loan she will be able to buy what is necessary for the crops.  She will carry out the purchases and the sales in San Juan and in Ventanas. 

Her dream is to buy land to plant more and to obtain better profits.  The challenges that she faces are the lack of money and the competition.

In her free time she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicides, fertilizers and urea.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro es un joven de 18 años de edad, no tiene hijos y es soltero. Vive con su mamá, quien lo apoya económicamente.  Es un hombre muy estudioso y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por eso se motivó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación, para destinarlo al pago de una capacitación en Servicio de Mesa y Bar, ya que quiere adquirir conocimientos y experiencia para poder encontrar más oportunidades de empleo en un futuro cercano. Su meta es terminar sus estudios y poder ejercer su profesión más adelante, para poder apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su mamá.
texts.en: Alejandro is 18 years old.  He is single and has no children.  He lives with his mother, who provides financial support.  Alejandro is very studious and has a great desire to move ahead in life.  With this as motivation, Alejandro is applying for a loan to pay for training in waiting and bar services as he wants to develop his knowledge and experience.  He will then have more employment opportunities in the near future.  Alejandro's goal is to finish his studies and, later, to put his knowledge into practice so that he can contribute to the household and provide his mother with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to pay for training in waiting and bar services.

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es:
José, es una hombre de hogar, vive con su esposa, tiene  dos hijos, los cuales son independientes  y viven en terrenos de su padre con su respectivo hogar, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a  la agricultura, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza desde hace 20 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para  el cultivo  tales como: abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas y pago de mozos; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener lo requerido para la producción de maíz y maicillo.
Su sueño es ampliar sus cultivos, agregar otro tipo de cultivo. Su objetivo es construir una casa y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is the head of his household. He lives with his wife. They have two children, who are independent and live in their own homes on their father's land. He does not have family members who live outside of the country.

He makes a living in agriculture, the trade that he learned from his parents and has been doing for the past 20 years.

The loan that he needs will allow him to buy the supplies necessary for farming, like fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides, and paying his workers. This investment will help him to obtain the necessary items for the production of corn and sorghum. 

His dream is to increase the amount of crops and to add another type of crop. His goal is to build a house and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides, and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad, soltero. Desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron las actividades agrícolas para contribuir a los gastos del hogar. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a sus padres para prepararse para irse al terreno que alquilan, pasa todo el día trabajando en la noche como cuidandero de otros terrenos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un par de bueyes, que le ayuden a arar la tierra en donde hace sus cultivos y además prestar sus servicios a otros agricultores por los que recibirá un pago que utilizara para el sustento de su familia 
 En un futuro, Planea comprar un terreno para sembrar ya que el que actualmente posee es alquilado
texts.en:
Elmer, who is 24, is a young, single entrepreneur.  When he was very young, his parents taught him how to farm so he could contribute to the family expenses.  Along with his parents, he gets up at 4am to get ready to go to the plot of land which they rent.  He spends all day working and, at night, works at other farms as a caretaker.

He will use the loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo to buy a pair of oxen to help him to plough the land where he grow his crops.  He will also offer his services to other farmers so as to receive payment which he can use to support his family.  In the future, he plans to buy a plot of arable land because the land he farms at present is rented.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen to help him to plough the land where he grow his crops.  He will also offer his services to other farmers so as to receive payment which he can use to support his family.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy temprana edad sus padres le enseñaron las actividades agrícolas, ya que esa era la única fuente de ingresos. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para prepararse junto a su esposa e hijos para ir a trabajar en donde tiene sus cultivos; posteriormente él llega a su casa para prestar sus servicios como motorista de un camión de carga.
Él es un hombre muy luchador y con una visión muy interesante para su futuro y el de su familia. Ha identificado que el negocio de granjas de pollos es muy rentable y él desea iniciar con esta actividad. Debido a eso, esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 500 pollos inicialmente y poco a poco ira comprando otros 500, ya que su meta es vender 1,500. 

Según vaya avanzando el negocio, José planea en un futuro poder comprar un camión y poder realizar viajes de pasajeros y de carga.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old, married, and has three children. From a young age, his parents taught him the agricultural business, since this was the only source of income. 

He wakes up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare to go with his wife and children to work with his crops. Later, he arrives at his house to lend his services as a driver of a cargo truck. 

He is a very determined man and he has a very interesting vision for his future and his family's future. He has verified that the business of raising chickens is very profitable and he would like to begin this business. Due to this, he requests a loan from Fundación Campo to buy 500 chickens initially and, little by little, buy another 500; his goal is to sell 1,500.

As his business progresses, José plans to buy a truck and transport passengers and cargo.

loans.use: to buy 500 chickens initially and, little by little, buy another 500; his goal is to sell 1,500.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Estoy Con Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO ESTOY CON DIOS
Don Alfredo es originario del municipio de Tecpán, tiene 48 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos menores de edad él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años.
Don Alfredo es una persona trabajadora desde hace varios años el se dedica a la siembra de tomate, ejotes maíz, frijol, gracias a dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante con su familia.
Su esposa se dedica al comercio y gracias al apoyo de ella y el de toda su familia él sigue adelante con su trabajo ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El sueño de él es construir su propio invernadero para que en la temporada de lluvia no quede afectado por la escases de agua, ya que así podrá tener mejores cosecha y mejores ganancias para poder mandar sus hijos a la escuela, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo de maiz,tomate ejote etc. el con mucho deseo de superarse solicita este credito esperando que ustedes le puedan apoyar.
texts.en:
"Estoy con Díos" communal bank

Alfredo is originally from the town of Tecpán and is 48 years old.  He has young children under his responsibility and, for some years, has been earning a living in farming.

Alfredo is hard-working and, for some years, has been making a living growing tomatoes, green beans, corn, and beans.  Thanks to God, little by little, Alfredo has managed to get ahead with his family.

Alfredo's wife makes a living in business.  Thanks to his wife and the whole family's support, Alfredo has been able to progress with his work and, with this work, he is able to get ahead.

Alfredo's dream is to build his own greenhouse so that the heavy rains do not affect his crops in the rainy season.  With a greenhouse he would have better harvests and higher profits and he would be able to send his children to school.  Alfredo is applying for this loan to buy seeds and musicals to grow tomatoes, green beans, corn and more.  Alfredo has a great desire to overcome obstacles and is applying for this loan hoping that you will be able to support him.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for plants.

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik lives in a very nice city, Dilijan, which has an incredibly rich and colorful nature. Razmik has the vocational education of engineering, but he has never worked in his specialty. After passing his military service in the Soviet Army Razmik has worked as a driver for many years. 

Razmik is 57 years old and he could never think that he would leave his native city one day, because as he says, he is just in love with his birthplace, but for five years he lived and worked in the Russian Federation. After coming back Razmik got married and decided to stay in Dilijan and to establish a farm. Today in his farm Razmik has five cows, five piglets and ten chickens.

He needs the loan to buy two calves, two piglets and a lot of animal fodder in order to enlarge his farm.

loans.use: To buy two calves, two piglets and a lot of animal fodder in order to enlarge his farm

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be respectful and humble. He operates a food stall where he sells fried cassava. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonality of the product. 

He will use the 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy nails, iron sheets, timber, etc., to construct a decent stall for the business. His business goal is to own a hotel within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy nails, iron sheets, timber, etc., to construct a decent stall for the business.

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr: Ismaila habite au Sénégal célibataire âgé de 24 sans enfants , il est maçon de profession depuis 7 ans , son activité primaire est le commerce.Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000f pour son commerce .Ismaila tous les samedi et les dimanches de 08h à 17h ,il va en brousse acheter du bois et charbon de bois pour venir revendre dans la ville et les autres jours de la semaine ,il est dans son métier de maçonnerie ,il très brave , toujours en mouvement pour gagner dans sa vie. Ses ambitions sont:marié une femme et avoir une maison dans l'avenir
texts.en: Living in Senegal, Ismaila is unmarried, 24 years old, and without children. He has been a mason by trade for seven years. His main work is in commerce. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for his business. Every Saturday and Sunday from 8 AM to 5 PM, Ismaila  goes into the countryside to purchase wood and charcoal and then returns to the city. On the other days of the week, he practices his trade as a mason. He is a good and honest man always on the go, so as to earn his living. His ambitions are: to marry a woman and have a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wood and charcoal

loans.name: Varazdat

texts.en:
Varazdat is a young businessman of 20 years old, who lives with his mother in a small city of Vanadzor. He rents a stall and he has a kind of car service center, where he repairs car engines. For several years Varazdat’s father used to do the same work and for a long time Varazdat was his father’s pupil and he learnt very fast all the details and skills in this field. Very soon his father handed him his business, being sure that his son is ready to work alone and with high quality. Now Varazdat’s father is in Russian Federation in an abroad works, so Varazdat manages all the works alone and perfectly. He is very clever and honest young man, to whom clients trust very much and they know that any problems connected with their car will be properly solved by him.
Varazdat asks a loan of 160.000 Armenian drams in order to buy some types of tools that he needs during his repairing activities very much.

loans.use: To buy some types of tools that he needs very much for doing repairs

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 34 años de edad es estado civil Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con el comyugue y los hijos en el Recinto SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla CEVALLOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto SAN FRANCISCO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Sonia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz, arroz, soya, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras lo realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo que le hace falta apara las siembras y aumentar los ingresos.
El sueño es que el negocio surga y que de ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ayudar a la familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 34 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children. She lives with her partner and children in the district of San Francisco in the Ventanas Canton, which is in the Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the Cevallos branch, located in the San Francisco district. She works in agriculture and livestock. She grows corn, rice, and soy, and also raises chickens and pigs.

She requests this loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she is lacking for her crops and increase her income.

Her dream is that her business grows and provides her with income. In her free time, she likes to help her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer, manure, and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Felix tiene 34 años de edad es  de estado civil Union Libre  tiene un hijo vive con la madre y el hijo en el Recinto SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla CEVALLOS se encuentra ubicada el  recinto SAN FRANCISCO, perteneciente a la parroquia Sa Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas. 

Felix se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, herbicidas.

Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos y fertilizantes. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es aumentar los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el boli.
texts.en:
Felix is 34 years old and has a partner.  He lives with his mother and son in the San Francisco precinct of the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

Felix is a member of the "Cevallos" communal bank, which is located in the San Francisco precinct.  The communal bank is in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo and works in farming.

Felix makes a living in farming - he grows corn and rice and also raises farmyard animals such as chickens and pigs.  He is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertiliser, urea and herbicides.

Felix will be able to buy supplies and fertiliser with this loan.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

The loan helps Felix to increase his income and his crops.  His dream is to increase his crops.  In his free time, Felix likes playing sports, particularly volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, urea and herbicides.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a hardworking man who ensures that the needs of his family are met. He does farming, i.e., planting vegetables for sale to his customers. Here he comes to you for another loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy fertilizer and more seeds for planting. He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more seeds for planting.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is married, and has children. He has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

He has operated a business selling fruit and vegetables; he sells to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenges are the high cost of transportation to his place of operation, and stiff competition. 

With the Ksh 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to sell. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the group called 'God's time' in Teshie; they have been associated with ID Ghana for three years. They are in different trades, like cereals, provisions, drinks, wax-prints, fish, and bread.

One member is Cecilia. She is married, 52 years old, and has two children. Her business is selling wax-prints, towels, bed sheets, and kids wear.  She has a stall in the market, where she sells her products; she works from 8 am to 5 pm. She already has ten years experience in this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her stuff from home.

Cecilia is requesting a loan of GHS 1,500 to purchase wax-prints, towels. bed sheets, and kids wear to sell.

The borrower standing far right is Cecilia. 

The group members are grateful to those who will be part of their dream through this platform, and they promise to make their repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase wax-prints, towels, bed sheets and kids wear to sell.

loans.name: Nizamije

texts.en:
Nizamije is a villager with an extensive expertise of almost 20 years in agriculture. She is living in southeastern Albania. She wants to buy a dairy cow with this loan.

Nizamije is in her late fifties and is married to her husband, who has been unable to move due to his disability these past 10 or so years. She also is raising a nephew whose parents passed away in a tragic car accident. 

“I start my day early in the morning taking care of people and animals and end the day with the same activity, taking care of people and animals. It’s a daily routine that I can’t miss it, even for one day. I feel exhausted some days, and I just want to lie down and do nothing, but I can’t, so I’ve got to go on with my routine. That’s it. No choices, I’ve got to raise my nephew and look after my husband,” Nizamije ended her talk to the loan officer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou âgée de 24 ans vie au Sud du Sénégal avec son mari et mère d'un garçon de 1 an ,elle avait bénéficié d'un premier crédit de 400 000f remboursé à échéance et destiné à acheter un congélateur pour son commerce de glace et jus et de fruits .Aissatou ,très active dans son commerce ,elle sollicite un crédit 400 000f pour acheter de l'huile de palme , des balais qu'elle envoie à Dakar auprès de sa sœur pour revendre et avoir un bénéfice . Elle n'a aucune charge à supporter,toutes les dépenses de la famille sont faites par son mari.Elle souhaite être une grande commerce à l'aide de u imcec et de kiva.
texts.en:
Aissatou, aged 24, lives in southern Senegal with her husband. She is the mother of a 1-year-old boy. She had benefited from an initial loan of 400,000 francs, repaid on time, for purchasing a freezer for her business selling ice and fruit juices. 

Aissatou, who is very active in her work, is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to purchase palm oil and brooms that she sends to Dakar via her sister to sell and earn a profit. She has no expense. All family expenses are covered by her husband. With the help of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC and Kiva, she would like to become a major merchant.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and brooms to sell

loans.name: Claveles De Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
Santo Domingo Xenacoj is located in the central region of Guatemala and the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, 'Claveles de Xenacoj' or the 'Carnations of Xenacoj' is located here. The women chose this name because they love flowers, which grow in abundance in many parts of Guatemala. The population of this area works in agriculture and grows corn, beans, vegetables, and coffee. They also produce handicrafts, like candles and woven cotton items.

Maria Calixta, a 24-year-old, single mother of a four-year-old boy, is a member of the Trust Bank. She understands that it is never too late to seek personal and professional improvement. Because her son has not begun his own education, Maria Calixta is enrolled in her very first year of school which she attends over the weekends. She is most excited about what she is learning and has the motivation to learn as much as possible, especially learning to read and write in Spanish. She is doing this, so that she can be well-prepared to help her own son when he begins his education. She is hopeful for a better future for his generation.

Like many in her village, Maria Calixta works in the production of handicrafts, producing napkins, placemats, tablerunners, and caps, which she sells in Santo Domingo Xenacoj and in neighboring markets. She also has clients to whom she delivers items on a regular basis.

Maria Calixta is requesting a loan of USD 384 in order to buy various colors of yarn, to continue to operate her small business. She looks forward to increasing her sales, so that she can sustain her own life and that of her child.

All of the ladies of 'Claveles de Xenacoj' want to express their gratitude to Kiva investors for the opportunity to secure a loan. They understand that, with this opportunity and a little education, they can create a better world for themselves, their families, and their communities.

loans.use: to buy yarn for her handicrafts business.

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Juan II; está en su ciclo número  3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas y cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por crecer y por ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Clara quien hace decoraciones de fiestas de cumpleaños, como ser centros de mesas, regaleras, y todo tipo de artículos para decorar, se debe destacar que ella es una mujer con muchas ansias de crecer, y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, adornos, entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Juan II" is in its 3rd loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees of Fundacion Paraguaya.  In this group, every member is putting maximum effort into growth and helping their families.

One of the members is Clara, who makes decorations for birthday parties, such as centerpieces, party favor, and all types of decorative items. It should be noted that Clara is a woman who has a strong desire to grow her business and help her family through her work. 

Clara is requesting this loan to buy fabric, decorations, and other supplies that will help her to carry out her business plan, so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, decorations and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine mariée âgée de 37 ans habite au Sénégal dans la région du sud , mère de trois enfants qui sont tous à l'école française .L'ainé est en classe de 5em au collège et les deux sont à l'école primaire cm1 et ci . Yacine travail à l'université depuis 5 ans comme femme de ménage , démarre sa journée de 4h du matin à 7h 30mn .Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000f pour le commerce . Après la descente à l’université ,elle s'occupe de son commerce de draps de chaussures ou elle gagne de l'argent pour les dépenses de sa famille et les frais scolaires des enfants car son mari vie or du Sénégal et lui envoie de l’argent rarement. Yacine est une grande épargnante,elle a comme projet future avoir sa propre maison avec ses enfants.
texts.en:
Living in southern Senegal, Yacine is married, 37 years old, and the mother of three children, who are all at the French school. The oldest is in 7th grade, and the two are in 4th grade and in nursery school. Yacine has been working for five years at the university as a janitor. Her day starts at 4:00 in the morning and ends at 7:30. 

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for her business. After leaving work at the university, she sees to her business selling bed sheets and shoes. She earns the money from it to cover family expenses and her children's schooling costs, since her husband lives outside Senegal and rarely sends money to her. Yacine is saving a lot of money. Her future plans include having her own house with her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty se encuentra en el inicio del primer ciclo, el comité esta conformado por mujeres que están luchando por sus familias, ya que quieren ayudarles a tener lo que no pudieron tener.
Francisca es una de estas mujeres, quien se dedica a la decoración de eventos, ella es una mujer muy hábil en lo que hace, es por eso que tiene eventos por todos lados. Ella esta luchando y trabajando ya que quiere mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Ella solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, artículos de decoración, isopor y demás, y de esa forma seguir trabajando para poder ganarse el día a día. Agradece de esta ayuda ya que podrá seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
The group called “Kuña Aty” is starting its first loan cycle. This committee consists of women who fight for their families because they want to help them by providing the things they didn’t have.

Francisca is one of these women. She provides decoration services for events. Francisca is a woman who is very skillful at what she does, which explains why she has events everywhere. She is striving and working to improve her poverty situation.

Francisca is requesting assistance so that she can buy fabrics, decorations, styrofoam, and other items. This will enable her to continue working so that she can generate income each day. She is grateful for the assistance that will allow her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, decorations, styrofoam, and other items.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with children; he owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for the family. 

He has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby.  BUT, he faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. He dreams of expanding his business to be a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the Kshs 30,000, he wants to purchase bundles of charcoal to sell. 

Daniel decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Ibrahim.  He is single with a 10-year-old child. In 2009, Ibrahim established a bike and spare part business to generate income. His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are general community members. Ibrahim works seven days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about 900,000 SLL each month. 

Ibrahim is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase bike and spare parts to sell. In the future, he plans to build a house on his own. Ibrahim thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bike and spare parts to sell

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
For nearly ten years Gevorg, who lives in the village of Gugark in the Lori region, has been repairing shoes in a rented stall near Vanadzor wholesale market. 

Gevorg is married and he has three daughters, who are already married and live separately with their families. Gevorg loves his craft very much, since as he mentions, with the help of this job he earns money and provides for his family, and he has also become acquainted with many interesting and famous people (musicians, artists, scientists) who became good friends for him.

Gevorg needs some money in order to buy a shoe-making machine and some raw materials for his work. So he asks for 250,000 Armenian drams for that purchase.

loans.use: to buy a shoe-making machine and some raw materials for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Lamin.  He is married, and has two children, ages 11 & 7.  

In 2007, Lamin established his cell phone, mobile accessories, and credit vouchers business. He began his business because he wants to take care of his family. 

His business is located in out skirts of the city, and his main customers are general community people.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le800,000 every month from this business. 

Lamin would like a loan of Le5,000,000. Lamin requires a loan to buy more cell phones, mobile accessories, and credit vouchers to sell.   

In the future, Lamin plans to establish a bigger shop, build his own dwelling house and to give a quality education to his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cell phones, mobile accessories, and credit vouchers to sell.

loans.name: Mwanza

texts.en: Mwanza is a married man. He has children who attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. He has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door, where passersby and town dwellers are his potential customers. He faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season, when it becomes difficult to operate his business. With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle, which he uses in his transport business.

loans.name: Ericka Jackeline

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Desde pequeña ha sentido afición al trabajo, dado que lo ha hecho siempre con sus familiares.  Se dedica a su negocio de taller de costura junto a su madre, durante la mañana.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como técnico en la instalación de antenas; por ahora no tiene hijos.  Necesita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para su negocio, que son básicamente telas y cortes.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala.  Ever since she was very young she has been fond of working, given that she has always done this with her family.  She and her mother have a dressmaking workshop where she works in the mornings.  She is married, and her husband works as a technician installing antennas.  At this time, they have no children.

She needs a loan to buy raw materials for her business, specifically, fabric and hand-woven piecework.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business: fabric and hand-woven piecework

loans.name: Book Ndeye Group

texts.fr: Madame Adama est la présidente du groupement Book Ndèye qui regroupe cinq femmes habitant toutes le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois que c’est nécessaire. C’est elle qui a levé la main dans la photo. Adama est âgée de 55ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle évolue dans le commerce de différents produits , elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter des produits alimentaires qui entrent dans la préparation des jus locales comme le pain de singe, le sucre, le mil, les balais, et la pate d’arachide. Elle n’a aucunes charges spécifiques, elle a une expérience de 10ans dans cette activité. Adama commence sa journée à 08h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir elle veut développer son activité, augmenter ses revenus pour ne plus dépendre des crédits des mutuelles.
texts.en:
Adama is the president of the Book Ndeye Group, which includes five women who all live in the same district and who meet whenever necessary. She is shown in the photo with her hand raised. Adama is 55 years old, married and the mother of five children.

She is a merchant of diverse products, and she needs this loan to purchase the food supplies to make local juices, monkey bread, sugar, millet, brooms, and peanut paste. She has no specific dependents, and has had ten years of experience in this business. Adama begins her work day at 8:00 am and finishes at 6:00 pm. In the future she wants to expand her business, and increase her income so that she will no longer need to rely on group loans.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies to make local juices such as Ngalakh and Thiakry

loans.name: Mamadou Yoro

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou Yoro est un jeune informaticien de 27 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Il habite à environ 400km de la direction régionale de l’IMCEC où il fait parti des premiers sociétaires de ce guichet. D’ailleurs il a déjà eu à bénéficier de deux crédits payés sans difficile et veut un renouvellement  de 150000F CFA pour acheter un ordinateur portable.
Mamadou Yoro est célibataire mais il participe à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. 
Compte tenu de ses connaissances  en informatique, il désire réaliser un projet qui lui tient à cœur, celui d’ouvrir un cyber.
texts.en: Mr. Mamadou Yoro is a young computer engineer who is 27 years old, unmarried, and without children. He lives about 400 km from the regional management of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC where he is one of the first associates of the branch office. In addition, he has already benefited from two loans paid back without difficulty and wants a renewal of 150,000 francs CFA to purchase a laptop computer. Mamadou Yoro is unmarried, but he helps to take care of day-to-day expenses [of his family]. Given his knowledge of computers, he would like to realize his deeply-committed plans, that is, to open a cybercafé.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer and eventually open an internet café

loans.name: Papa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Papa, est agriculteur de profession, métier qu’il a hérité de ses parents et de ses ancêtres. Depuis le bas âge, il accompagnait son père au champ, actuellement, il a pris la relève. Pour préparer la campagne agricole, il s’est rapproché de l’IMCEC pour pouvoir bénéficier d’un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des semences et de l’engrais.
Papa est marié et gère les besoins quotidiens de sa famille, avec les revenus tirés de son activité.
Comme projet futur, il désire exploiter d’autres périmètres agricoles pour diversifier les cultures.
texts.en:
Papa is a farmer by profession, a trade he inherited from his parents and his ancestors. From an early age, he accompanied his father in the fields, and now he has taken over. To prepare for the agricultural season, he has come to IMCEC to benefit from a loan that will allow him to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Papa is married and manages the daily needs of his family, with the income he earns from his farming business. As a future project, he wants to pursue other agricultural areas to diversify his crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to prepare for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran lives in Kadjaran, which is in the Syunik region, with his family, where he is the only bread-winner. It is very hard for Seyran to work and at the same time to take care of his three children, since his wife has died and he was left to care for two. His elder son is married and he lives separately with his family, but the other two children (a son and a daughter) are still living with him. 

Seyran was educated as a lawyer, but has never had an opportunity to work in his specialty. He has worked for fifteen years at the Kajaran combine as a locksmith. At the same time Seyran runs his own business: a polyethylene towels wholesale trade. He mainly realizes it in Kadjaran and Kapan cities right from his own car, by driving it through crowded streets and places showing the range of his products. Seyran says that only together with his business and salary of his work, he can provide minimum living conditions to his children and to the family of his elder son. During recent years everyday difficulties and financial problems have became usual for Seyran and the only solution is assiduousness and the hope that all problems are temporary.

Seyran asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of polyethylene towels for reselling. Seyran's children hope very much that Kiva lenders will lighten and support their father to overcome their financial problems.

loans.use: To buy a lot of polyethylene towels for reselling in order to overcome his financial problems

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mariatu. She is married with two children, ages 17 and 18. In 2010, Mariatu established a local business where she sells palm oil and gari (tapioca flour made from cassava). She began her business to help her husband smoothly run their home. Mariatu's business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are general community members. She works seven days a week, 8 hours a day and earns about 500,000 SLL each month. 

Mariatu is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy palm oil and gari to sell. In the future, she plans to build her own house, give good education to her children, and develop her business. Mariatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and gari to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, sardines, coffee, tea, and a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old John.  He is married and has two children, ages 15 and 16. In 2005, John established a pharmacy. He began his business because he was trained as a pharmacist. John's business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are all classes of people. He works seven days a week, 12 hours a day and earns about 500,000 SLL each month. 

John is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more drugs to sell. In the future, he plans to construct a clinic and to educate his children. John thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Yeanoh.  She is a widow and has three children, ages one, seven, and 10. In 2003, Yeanoh established a grocery and palm oil business. She began her business to keep up her home after she lost her husband. Yeanoh's business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are people of all classes. She works seven days a week, ten hours a day and earns about 250,000 SLL each month.

Yeanoh is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more provisions and palm oil to sell. In the future, she plans to educate her children through university level. Yeanoh thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Abdulrahman.  He is single and has no children. 

In 2010, Abdulrahman established his Tele-Center & Barbing (Barber) Shop business. He began his business because he wants to generate income to further his education. His business is located on the outskirts of the city and his main customers are general community people. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. 

Abdulrahman would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy a clipper machine, movie chargers, and CD plates for resale. 

In the future, Abdulrahman plans to open another, bigger shop that will accommodate more customers and to also further his education up to university Level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a clipper machine, movie chargers, and CD plates for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks for resale

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Nanah. She is married with two children, ages 15 and 20. In 2005, Nanah established a Mega-Cola drinks and pure water business. She began her business after she lost her father and there was no one to pay for her schooling. Nanah's business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are people of all classes. She works seven day a week, 10 hours a day and earns about 350,000 SLL each month.

Nanah  is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more crates of Mega-Cola and cartons of pure water to sell. In the future, she plans to build a shop on her own to stop paying rent. Nanah thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of Mega-Cola and cartons of pure water to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family. She has operated a business selling vegetables and fruits for the past two years. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. With the KES 20,000 loan she is applying for, she wants to buy various types of vegetables and fruits. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy various types of vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman with eight children, all of whom are adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. For the past five years, she has operated a cooking business. She mentioned high costs and seasonality as her major challenges. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil to use in cooking food. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil to use in cooking food.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of two children, who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for school fees. For the past nine years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding the business and establishing a boutique in the future. With the loan that she is applying for, of KES 20,000, she wants to buy bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en: Nzingo is married, and she has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family and school fees for her children. For the past two years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling at wholesale to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the business. She dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future. With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to buy bags of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a married mother of four children, who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for school fees. For the past year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding the business and establishing a boutique in the future. With the loan that she is applying for, of KES 10,000, she wants to buy bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married and has been blessed with three children. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. For the past three years, she has operated a food stall, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to buy bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mutangili

texts.en: Mutangili is a married man with children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is for school fees. For the past three years, he has operated a farming business, selling produce from home to his neighbors and passersby. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business, and he dreams of establishing a larger business in the future. With the loan that he is applying for, of KES 10,000, he wants to buy cereals and fertilizers for his farm. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more material for her water production business.

loans.name: Sithwathwa

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 46-year-old Sithwathwa from Bulawayo. She is married and has two children. The older child is in college, and her last-born is receiving primary education at a local school. Her husband works as a teacher. Sithwathwa runs a retail business, selling clothes and footwear. She also sells schoolwear, handbags, African attire, hair pieces and other beauty products. The business has been in operation for 14 years. She says the main challenges she faces are lack of working capital and competition. Sithwathwa has applied for a loan of $500 to buy clothes and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to supplement their household income and be able to pay fees and improve their business. In the future Sithwathwa plans open a clothes boutique.

loans.use: to order stocks of clothes, footwear, schoolwear and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 22-year-old Cynthia from Bulawayo. She is married, and the couple have one child. Cynthia runs a retail business. She mainly sells clothes, including jeans, trousers, skirts, suits for both men and women, and footwear. She also stocks other goods, such as suitcases, blankets and solar panels. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges she faces are competition from larger retailers and high travel costs and import duties. Cynthia has applied for a loan of $400 to buy clothes and solar panels for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare and enable her to pay for her kid's education. In the future, Cynthia plans open a boutique in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes and solar panels for resale.

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
Ana tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija. Desde hace varios años trabaja en la agricultura, lo aprendió de sus padres. se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para prepararse e irse al lugar en donde cultivan y en la tarde se dedica a preparar comida típica (tostadas, atol, pupusas etc.)Para obtener ingresos para el sustento de ella y su hija, ella es padre y madre para su hija.
Ella desea tener otras actividades que le ayuden a obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Debido a ello, esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos vacas lecheras y procesar la leche en lácteos y producir quesillo, crema, queso, para vender. Con la venta de lácteos mejorara su negocio lo que le generara mejores ingreso para el sustento de su familia. Su deseo es continuar comprando más vacas ya que es una actividad que deja buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 27, is the single mother of a daughter. She has been farming, a trade she learned from her parents, for some years. She gets up at 5 AM to go to her field, and, in the afternoon, she prepares local foods such as tostadas, atole, and pupusas to earn money to support herself and her daughter, to whom she is both mother and father.

Ana wants to engage in other activities to earn income to pay household expenses. She has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy two milk cows and produce milk products like cheese and cream to sell. Selling milk products will expand her business and increase her income to support her family. She wants to buy more cows because they generate good income.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and produce milk products.

loans.name: Jorge Edilberto

texts.es: Jorge Edilberto es un hombre de 47 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde joven ha adquirido experiencia en la actividad agropecuaria y, actualmente se dedica a cultivar yuca, aguacate y plátanos, tiene ganado y engorda cerdos para la venta, con esto ha logrado obtener ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Es un señor trabajador y dedicado, siempre luchando para sacar a sus hijos adelante, por eso se motiva para solicitar el crédito con la Corporación y desea invertirlo en arreglar el corral, comprar alimento para los animales y comprar más vacas, con el fin de generar más ingresos para tener una estabilidad económica. Su principal sueño es comprar más terreno para poder criar más animales y tener más cultivos y así poder brindar bienestar y mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Edilberto is a 47-year-old gentleman who is the father of three children. He and his spouse are in a common-law relationship. From a young age, Jorge has acquired experience in farming activities. He currently grows cassava, avocados, and bananas. Jorge also has cattle and fattened pigs to sell, which generate income to sustain his household.

This dedicated and hardworking man always strives to help his children get ahead. For this reason, he was motivated to request a loan from Interactuar because he wants to repair a corral, buy feed for his animals, and acquire more cows. In the end, he hopes to generate more income so that he will have financial stability. His main goal is to buy more land for raising more animals and growing more crops. This will enable him to provide for the welfare of his entire family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to repair a corral, buy animal feed, and acquire more cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertiliser to help his new plants grow and to pay day labourers who help him clean his farm

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, vive con sus padres, su padre tiene 82 años de edad y su madre 90 años de edad, asimismo tiene una hija, todos trabajan en armonía para el mismo negocio. El, se dedica a la venta de zapatos y mas, posee dos puestos  y lo realiza todos los días, lo desempeña desde hace 25 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar zapatos, cinchos, gorras, lentes, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y brindarles una mejor satisfacción a los clientes.
Su sueño es tener otro negocio  cercano y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his parents.  His father is 82 years old and his mother is 90.  In addition, he has a daughter.  They all work in harmony in the same business.  Luis has a business selling shoes and other items.  He has 2 sales posts, and he works every day.  He's had this business for 25 years.  

Luis needs a loan to buy shoes, belts, caps, sunglasses, and other products.  This investment will help him to strengthen his business and satisfy his customers.  His dream is to have another business close by, and to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes, belts, caps, sunglasses, and other items

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Il possède un champ où il cultive d’habitude des légumes. Il s’appelle Sadio, il est marié, âgé de 34 ans et père de 2 enfants. Monsieur Sadio est un novice dans le crédit car cela fait juste cinq mois qu’il a ouvert son compte à l’IMCEC. Il vient solliciter un montant de 200000F CFA afin de pouvoir acheter des semences et de l’engrais pour préparer la campagne agricole.
 Sadio vit avec ses parents et participe à la dépense quotidienne  de toute la famille. Grâce au crédit, il peut  désormais épargner et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
Il désire exploiter d’autres périmètres culturaux et diversifier la culture.
texts.en:
He owns a field where he usually grows vegetables. His name is Sadio. He is married, 34 years old, and a father of two. Mr. Sadio is a novice with borrowing because it has only been five months since he opened his IMCEC account. He is here to request the amount of 200,000 francs CFA to be able to purchase some seeds and fertilizer to prepare for planting crops. 

Sadio lives with his parents and helps to cover the day-to-day expenses of the whole family. Thanks to loans, he can now save money and improve his family's living conditions. He would like to make use of other fields for crops and to diversify his plantings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to prepare for planting crops

loans.name: Denise Mané

texts.fr:
Âgée de 42 ans, la dame Denise Mané, est mariée et mère de 7 enfants.  Elle loge a environ quelques km du guichet de IMCEC qui se trouve dans cette localité. Elle est une femme débrouillarde qui s’active dans le commerce d’huile de palme et de pâte d’arachide et cela depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle a démarré avec un faible capital et avec ses propres moyens. Elle fait le voyage elle-même pour aller chercher la marchandise et venir la placer dans le voisinage où elle compte la majorité de sa clientèle. Elle appuie son époux dans la gestion de la maison et s’occupe aussi de la scolarité de ses enfants : elle leur paie des cours de renforcement.
Elle désire devenir une grande commerçante et ouvrir un magasin pour stocker la marchandise car elle aimerait aussi vendre des balaies, du nététou qui entre dans la préparation  de beaucoup de plats sénégalais, du poisson séché et fumé.
texts.en:
Denise Mané is 42 years of age, married and the mother of seven children. She is living a few kilometers from the IMCEC branch located in her area. She is a resourceful woman who sells palm oil and peanut paste, and has been in this business for over 15 years. She started with a small amount of her own capital. She makes ​​the journey herself to purchase her merchandise and brings it back to the neighborhood where the majority of her customers are located.

She helps her husband with the household expenses and is also responsible for the education of her children; she pays for their reinforcement classes. She hopes to someday become a large retailer and open a store where she can stock merchandise, as she would also like to sell brooms, nététou (a traditional sauce) that is used in the preparation of many Senegalese dishes, and dried and smoked fish.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and peanut paste for resale.

loans.name: Folototo

texts.en:
Folototo is a 27-year-old married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing a vegetable garden to earn a living. 

Folototo has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, fertilizer, barbed wire, a water hose and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Folototo will spend her profits to help her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, fertilizer, barbed wire, a water hose, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Faamati

texts.en: Faamati is 30 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pastries and ice cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a deep freezer, oven, sack of flour, sugar, yeast and dripping oil. In the future, Faamati hopes to improve and expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to its financial services.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients for a new food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy powdered milk, mayonnaise, sardines, and other items to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income. They also grow fruit and other crops on their farm, such as bananas and papayas. 
 
She and her husband have five children. 
  
Carmelita is requesting a loan in order to buy rice seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With this investment, she and her husband will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. 

Carmelita dreams of improving their business so that it will be an increasingly stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Amidu.  He is married and has four children ages three, 13, 14 and 22. Amidu has two additional dependents who live with him to help with the household chores.  In 1986, he established a business selling jeans, blouses, t-shirts, suitcases, and belts. Amidu began his business to be self-reliant after helping his late brother with his business. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Amidu works seven days a week, 12 hours a day and earns about 1,750,760 SLL each month. 

Amidu is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to pay for additional jeans, shoes, shirts, and suitcases.  He has previously received and repaid seven loans. Amidu hopes that his loan will increase his stock and raise his profit. In the future, he plans to improve his clothing business and open outlets. Amidu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shoes, shirts, and suitcases

loans.name: Angel Melecio

texts.es: El cliente vive en Machala.  Inició en esta actividad años atrás, vendiendo zapatillas a crédito y recorriendo el sector céntrico de la ciudad.  Es casado y su esposa le ayuda en su negocio vendiéndole a los vecinos del barrio donde están viviendo.  También tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela fiscal.  Necesita el dinero del préstamo para invertir en mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en: This borrower lives in Machala.  Years ago, he started this business selling slippers on credit, going around the center of the city to sell.  He is married, and his wife helps him with the business, selling to neighbors in the area where they are living.  He also has 2 children who attend public school.  He needs the money from this loan to invest in merchandise for his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business (slippers)

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia, age 45, earns an income by buying and selling such items as children's shoes, dresses, bags, socks, and umbrellas. She lives with her husband and their four children in Talibon, Bohol. The oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest is six. 

In order to remain able to cater to the needs of her customers, Lucrecia has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 21,000, which she will use to replenish her inventory of shoes, dresses, socks, bags, and umbrellas. 

In the future, Lucrecia would like expand her business in order to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes, dresses, socks, bags, and umbrellas to offer for sale

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abdul. He is married and has one child, aged 5 years. In 2008, Abdul established his drugs business. He began his business because of a low salary income. His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are all classes of people. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le500,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more drugs of different kinds for resale. In the future, Abdul plans to complete his studies in medicine and later open a hospital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: Ma.erlinda

texts.en:
Ma.erlinda is a 49-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in rice farming. She has been growing rice for more than 15 years now. 

Ma.erlinda has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and more rice seedlings, to increase the harvest and augment her income. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business to improve her family's livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more rice seedlings

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Abdulai. He is married and has two children aged 13 and eight years. Although he does not have an education, he was able to establish a grocery store business in 2003. His store is located in the outskirts of Freetown and his main customers are local people of all classes. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about 400,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Abdulai has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL so that he can buy more goods for his store. In the future, he plans to send his children to university and to develop his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his store

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, age 54, is a fish vendor. She earns an additional income by growing, harvesting, and selling rice. She lives with her husband in Talibon, Bohol. 

In order to be able to better sustain the family's daily needs, Patricia has requested a loan of PhP 13,000, which she will use to buy fish to offer for sale as well as fertilizers and rice seedlings for her farm. This investment will allow her to earn more income. 

In the future, Patricia would like to expand both her businesses so that she can help to alleviate the family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale as well as to purchase fertilizers and rice seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Leine

texts.en:
Leine is a 49-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in charcoal making. She has been producing charcoal for almost 5 years. She earns 6,000 PHP a month from selling charcoal. 

Due to lack of financial capacity to continue her livelihood activity, Leine has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more firewood and dry, empty coconut shells in order to produce more charcol. In the future, Leine would like to expand her charcoal-making business to provide her family with proper diets and good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and dry, empty coconut shells

loans.name: Sunnah

texts.en:
Sunnah, age 38, established her textiles business in 2005 because she wanted to assist her husband in supporting the family. Her business is located in the city center and her primary customers are women. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,132,950 every month. 

She and her husband have two children, ages five and 13 years old.

Sunnah has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and is now requesting a new loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She will use her loan funds to buy additional cotton, wax, and brillion. She is confident that this loan will improve her stock and raise her profit. 

In the future, Sunnah plans to expand the business to the outskirts of town, an investment that she feels will help her to make more profit and thus be better able to provide for her children. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new textiles to offer for sale

loans.name: Edward T.

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Edward. He is married and has three children, ages 5, 7, and 15. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help in his business.  

In 2009, Edward established his food and drinks business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant, after retiring from government service. His business is located in city center and his main customers are patients, hospital staff, and visitors. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,940,400 every month from this business. 

Edward would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now he requires a new loan in order to buy additional rice, onions, and drinks. He hopes that this loan can improve his stock and raise the profits. 

In the future, Edward plans to expand the business to the frontage of the location and hopes to improve the business and be able to care of the needs of the family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, onions, soft drinks, and other beverages.

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Idriss. He is married and has three children, aged 3, 5, and 11. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help his wife's younger sister with her education. 

In 1998, Idriss established his textiles, trimmings, and soft drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,280,550 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Idriss has already received and successfully repaid six loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional drinks, poplin and thread. He hopes that this loan can improve his stock and raise his profits. In the future, Idriss plans to improve the soft drinks trade and expand; he hopes to be able to open outlets within the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles and soft drinks to sell in his store

loans.name: Lila Unicia

texts.es:
Lila tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos vive con los hijos y el conyugue en SAN FRANCISCO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Lila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en Ventanas. 

El sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener mejores utilidades, en los tiempos libres le gusta leer y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Lila, 41, lives in a civil union and has two children. She lives with her children and husband in San Franciso in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank Ventanilla Cevallos, located in San Francisco in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, and she is a farmer. 

Lila grows corn, soybeans, and rice and raises chickens and pigs. She has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide. With the loan, she will be able to buy needed farming supplies to protect against pests and disease. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. She dreams of growing her business and profit. She likes to read and listen to music in her free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Mariuxi Teresa

texts.es:
MARIUXI tiene 25 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la madre en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Mariuxy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura, El sueño es tener mi negocio propio. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Mariuxi, 25, is single and has two children. She lives with her children and her mother in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank Ventanilla Cevallos, located in San Francisco in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, and she is a farmer.

Mariuxi grows corn, soybeans, and rice. She has applied for a loan to buy seed, insecticide, fertilizer, and herbicide. The loan will let her buy needed farming supplies. She dreams of owning her own business, and she likes to play indoor soccer in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, fertilizer, and herbicide.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
MARIANA tiene 52 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en Ventanas Provicia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura a la siemra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. 

El sueño es seguir mejorando en los cultivos para que haya mejores utilidades. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de paseo por los campos.
texts.en:
Mariana, 52, is married and has two children. She lives with her children and husband in Ventanas in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank Ventanilla Cevallos, located in San Francisco in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, and she is a farmer.

Mariana grows corn, soybeans, and rice. She has applied for a loan to buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer, and herbicide. The loan will let her buy needed planting supplies. She dreams of expanding her cropland to earn more income. She likes to walk through the fields in her free time.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer, and herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university classes and fees.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon on the island of Bohol in the Philippines. She has three children aged six, eight and 11 respectively. For almost five years now, she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for men and women, including shorts, blouses, t-shirts and pants. Aside from this, she also operates a vulcanizing shop for motorcycles. 

Jennifer has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more clothing and motorcycle spare parts for her businesses. In the future she would like to expand her clothing business to be more successful and also to provide her children with a quality education and healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and motorcycle spare parts for her businesses

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 60 años, es viuda y  vive  en su casa propia junto su sobrino y sus 3 hijos. Yolanda se dedica a  la costura, actividad que aprendió de su hermana.  Decidió iniciar su negocio independientemente, comprando una máquina de coser, empezó cociendo y buscando clientes ella sola, hace más de 15 años atrás. Le gusta su trabajo por el ingreso económico que le genera  para poder pagar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, además que le gusta coser, confeccionar lencería, ropas de todos los géneros y modelos. Se esfuerza para seguir progresando deseando en un futuro comprar su máquina que le facilitaría mucho más su trabajo y crecer en este rubro. Esto es el quinto préstamo con Kiva, y esta agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de su cuotas, como en los préstamos anteriores. Con el monto de 1500 nuevos soles,  invertirá en la compra de materiales para la costura tales como telas, elásticos, hilos y otros para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 60, is a widow who lives in her own house with her nephew and three children. Yolanda is a seamstress, a profession she learned from her sister. Over 15 years ago, she decided to open a business and bought a sewing machine, started sewing, and looked for her own clients. She likes the work because her income allows her to meet household expenses, and she likes to make all kinds of lingerie and clothing for men and women. 

She strives to be successful and someday will buy a machine to make her work easier and help her improve professionally. This is her fifth loan cycle with Kiva. She is grateful for the funding and hopes it will continue, so she promises to make her payments, as she has done with previous loans. With the loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy dressmaking materials like fabric, elastic, and thread for her business.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials like fabric, elastic, and thread.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, age 33, is a rice farmer. She lives with her husband and their four children in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a painter. Their eldest child is nine years old and the youngest is a seven-month-old baby. 

In order to be able to continue her farming business, Janeth has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers, which will help her to increase her harvest and augment her income.
