Rosie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is 36 years old. She lives with her family in the village of Geghi, which is in Syunik region. Armenuhi is married and has a daughter, who is school-aged. She has the specialty of nurse, but she has never worked. Since Armenuhi married, she became engaged in farming and agriculture. Armenuhi’s husband is unemployed and he helps his wife in farming very much. Together they cultivate vegetables (beans, cucumbers, radish and onions), various greens (parsley) and fruits (apricot, apple, peaches) and they keep chickens and ducks on the farm. They also have several bee hives. They sell all the products which are the result of their hard day and night work at the Kapan wholesale market.

Armenuhi and her husband have decided to try their luck in swine breeding, and they ask for a loan for the purchase of piglets. They will be very happy to have new success in swine breeding together with the help of Kiva and field partner Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and organize her new swine breeding business, which will help her to increase income from farming

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh, 46, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband earns a living working as a breakdown mechanic. Anh supports her family through the income she earns from running a cafe. She started this business five years ago. Anh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of coffee and soft drinks to stock her cafe and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and that this will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of coffee and soft drinks to stock her cafe and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando, es productor agropecuario en el oriente Antioqueño. Dedicado a la lechería desde hace más de 30 años, como actividad económica, la cual le ha permitido salir adelante con la compañía de su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. 
A sus 61 años de edad el señor Fernando desea tener un mayor número de ganado que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Razón por la que se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca productora de  leche.
texts.en:
Fernando is a farmer in east Antioquia.  He’s been a dairy farmer for more than 30 years.  This economic activity has made it possible for him and his family to move forward; his family consists of his wife and four children.

At the age of 61, Fernando wants to have a larger herd of cattle so his income will increase and he will be able this way to provide better quality of life for his family which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fatima De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fátima de la Concepción 45 años de edad soltera con dos hijos los cuales uno es independiente en cambio el otro aún está bajo su cargo debido a que es un niño especial, originaria del municipio de Chinandega donde predomina el comercio, el turismo, las playas entre otros, Fátima se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como: chinerías, cosméticos, ropa de niños, adultos, damas y caballeros, medicina popular, recargas de celular entre otros productos al igual que tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación que es una pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumos diarios para el hogar en cantidades pequeñas  como: bolsitas de café, de shampoo, detergentes, jabón de lavar, pasta dental, arroz en bolsa, aceite, azúcar, golosinas entre otros, en ambos negocios tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al crédito y al contado los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal toda su mercadería las mantiene en cuentas por cobrar, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar más su negocio , mejorar sus vivienda para darle un techo digno donde vivir a su hijo especial, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y de surtir su pequeña pulpería,  Fátima está muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas le han brindado a las personas de bajos recursos económicos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.-
texts.en:
45-year-old Fátima de la Concepción is single and has two children.  One of her children lives independently and the other is still her responsibility because he is a special needs child.  Fátima is from the town of Chinandega where commerce, tourism and the local beaches are important.  Fátima's business is selling general merchandise such as miscellaneous goods; cosmetics; children's, men's and women's clothing; over-the-counter medicines, air time for cell phones and other products.  She also has a small convenience store business in her home where she sells basic household products in small amounts such as sachets of coffee and shampoo, detergents, soap, toothpaste, bags of rice, oil, sugar, candies, etc.  Both of her businesses have regular and casual customers.  She sells her products for cash and on credit, receiving repayment weekly and fortnightly.  All of her merchandise is accounts receivable.  One of her dreams is to further grow her business.  She would also like to improve her home so that she can provide her special needs child with a decent home in which to live.

Fátima plans to invest this loan in working capital and stock her small convenience store.  She is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders have given to low income borrowers, enabling them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for her two businesses. To buy basic household products for her convenience store

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra Patricia, mayor de edad con un hijo aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Sandra es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de educación como Maestra en una escuela ubicada en una de las comarcas de Chinandega, el objetivo de este crédito es para levantar paredes y la instalación de techo para un cuarto, estas mejoras la ha querido realizar desde hace siete años pero poco a poco ha ido realizando ciertas mejoras en su hogar uno de sus sueños es ver terminada su vivienda y así tener una mejor condición de vida, el financiamiento es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cementos, bloques, arena, cal, zin, Perlines, hierro, clavos, mano de obra entre otros, Sandra agrace mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas ofrece a las personas de bajos recursos económicos para así tener un medio digno de vida.-
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia is an adult and is responsible for one child.  She is from the town of Chinandega, in the west of the country, and currently works for the Ministry of Education as a teacher.  She works in a school which is located in a region of Chinandega.

Sandra Patricia aims to use this loan to build a room, erecting some walls and installing a roof.  She has wanted to make these improvements to her home for seven years and has gradually been making other improvements.  One of her dreams is to see her house completed so that she can enjoy better living conditions.  She will use this loan to buy building supplies such as cement, blocks, sand, lime, metal sheets, roofing battens and nails.  She will also pay labor costs.  Sandra is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, lime, roof battens, nails, metal sheets, etc.

loans.name: Djekabara I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANAMBANI, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  BOYE , 1 ère debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village  et à OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djekabara 1 group are married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. They live in polygamous families in Banambani, one of the villages in Ouelessebougou, in the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance organisation in order to manage their farming businesses during the winter.
This is their eighth loan with the institution. Boye who is the first standing left to right in the photo, cultivates rice.
With her loan she plans to buy seeds and fertiliser and to pay for labouring costs for 0.5 hectares.
After the harvest she sells her production in the village and in Ouelessebougou, her clientele is made up of both consumers and retailers.
She plans to make a profit of 50.000FCFA per exploitation.
This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour costs and to purchase seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Simeon Arnulfo

texts.es: Simeón Arnulfo, mayor de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Simeón es un microempresario el cual  posee en su casa de habitación un molino eléctrico y de motor, el presta el servicio los treinta días del mes su jornada diaria es desde las 5Am hasta las 5PM y en ocasiones especiales atiende hasta por las noches, no es primera vez que solicita crédito él ya ha tenido aproximadamente unos 16 préstamos con león 2000 en los cuales se le han otorgado para realizar mantenimiento a los molinos y para mejorar su vivienda donde ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Simeón está solicitando nuevamente financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y darles mantenimiento a sus molinos que ya lo están necesitando. Simeon esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.-
texts.en:
Simeón Arnulfo is married and has two dependent children.  He is from Chinandega, in the west of the country.  Simeón is a micro-businessman who has an electric and motorized mill at home which he uses to provide a service every day of the month.  He works from 5.00am to 5.00pm every day and, on special occasions, he also works nights.  This is not the first time he has requested a loan.  He has received approximately 16 loans from León 2000 to service his mills and make home improvements.  He has proven himself to be punctual in making his repayments.

Simeón is requesting this loan to make some home improvements and to have his mills serviced as they currently need it.  He is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer those on a low income.

loans.use: to have his electric and motorized mills serviced and to make some home improvements

loans.name: Djekabara Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANAMBANI, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  FATOUMATA , 1 ère debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djekabara II group are married women who are on average 38 years old with five children. They live in polygamous  families in Banambani, one of the villages in Ouelessebougou, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance organisation in order to manage their farming businesses during the winter.
They  are on their eighth loan with the institution, repaid.
Fatoumata  who is the first standing from left to right in the photo, cultivates groundnuts.
With her loan she plans to buy seeds and fertiliser and to pay for labouring costs for 0.5 hectares.
After the harvest she sells her production in the village and in Ouelessebougou, to her clientele of consumers and retailers.
She plans to make a profit of 40.000FCFA per exploitation.
This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labouring costs and the purchase of seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Moise Sylvain

texts.fr: Moise est un jeune camerounais de 32 ans. Célibataire et père d'un enfant, il possède une boutique de vente d'accessoires de téléphones dans un quartier de la ville. exerçant aussi dans la vente des crédit de communication, Moise souhaite avec l'argent du crédit acheter les accessoires de téléphones en gros et également les crédits de communication. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjectés dans son activité afin de permettre à Moise d'avoir plutard une grande boutique et assurer l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Moise, age 32, is a young Cameroonian. He is unmarried and the father of one chid. He owns a shop in one neighborhood of the city where he sells phone accessories. He also sells communication credits.

With the money from the loan, he wishes to buy phone accessories wholesale and also communication credits. The profits generated will be reinvested in his business, in order to make it possible for him to later have a large store and ensure his child receives an education.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and communication credits

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income by working as a mechanic. She has been running a business of selling fruits to people in her community for five years.

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a great quantity and variety of fruits for selling. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a great quantity and variety of fruits for selling.

loans.name: Trach

texts.en:
Trach, 42, is married. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a mechanic. Trach supports her family by performing sewing services. She started this business 13 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more sewing materials, such as threads, cloth and sewing accessories to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more sewing materials, such as threads, cloth and sewing accessories to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Reneta

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Reneta works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending. Reneta is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable-vending business.

Reneta has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in the education of her children as well as in their household expenditures. Aside from her variety store, she also has an apartment for additional income. She works hard to provide for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn hopes for a continuous growth in her business and dreams to give her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorena Yadira

texts.es: Lorena Yadira 33 años de edad casada con un hijo, menor de edad, del domicilio de Chinandega zona ubicado en el occidente del país, Lorena es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de educación como Maestra en una esc. Ubicada en una de las comarcas de Chinandega, el objetivo de este crédito es para realizar mejoras en su vivienda construcción de un cuarto debido a que el invierno esta en puertas y no desea mojarse muchos menos que su hijo se le pueda enfermar, así le ofrecería un techo digno donde vivir, anteriormente su vivienda era forrada con  tablas y zin , pero ella poco a poco ha venido construyendo su hogar con muchos esfuerzos uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para el futuro de su hijo, el financiamiento de este crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: bloques, cemento, cal, arena, piedrín, zin, hierro, Perlines, entre otros más.
texts.en:
Lorena Yadira, 33, is married and has a minor child, and the famiy lives  in Chinandega in the western part of the country.  Lorena is an active employee of the ministry of education and works as a teacher at a school in Chinandega.  The purpose of this loan is to renovate her home to prepare it for the winter season, to ward off humidity and to put a decent roof over the house to make sure her son does not get sick.  The house used to be lined inside with boards and metal sheeting but little by little Yadira has been making improvements with much effort.

Her goal is to finishing building the house for her son to have in the future.  The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, lime, sand, gravel, zinc, iron, beams, etc

loans.use: To buy constuction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, lime, zinc, beams and to hire workers.

loans.name: Elizabeth Abigail

texts.es: Elizabeth Abigail, 31 años de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad, de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Elizabeth se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable con deseos de superación personal. En sus tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar en familia con su esposo e hijos preparándoles deliciosos manjares típicos de esa zona como: gallo pinto, sopas, entre otros, por falta de recursos económicos no logra terminar sus estudios debido que proviene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar con los gastos en su hogar gracias a su espíritu de superación y de salir adelante inicia su  propio  negocio con fondos propios  como una alternativa de trabajo para apoyar con los ingresos y gastos  de su nuevo hogar, el cual consiste en la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños, al igual que cosméticos, entre otros, de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación a clientes fijos y eventuales, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreos, ella le dedica  unas 9 horas diarias a su negocio, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y de surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería en general y así obtener un poco más de ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Abigail, 31 years old, is married with three young children.  She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the western part of the country.  Elizabeth is characterized as being a hard-working and responsible woman with a desire for personal development.  In her free time she likes to enjoy her family, being with her husband and children preparing delicious traditional food for them from that area like “gallo pinto” (rice and beans) and soup, among other things.  Due to a lack of economic resources she didn’t manage to finish her studies.  As she comes from a humble family of few economic resources, she saw the need to work from a very young age to help with the household expenses.  

Thanks to her spirit for overcoming and getting ahead she started her own business with her own funds as an alternative form of work to support with the income the expenses of her new home.  The work consists of selling merchandise in general such as new clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children as well as cosmetics, among other things, as a traveling vendor and in her home to regular and occasional customers.  She makes her purchases in cash in wholesale markets.  She dedicates some 9 hours a day to her business.  The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business in the buying and selling of merchandise in general and thus to obtain a little more income for her household.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing for children, men and women and cosmetics, among other things.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
This is Genalyn, 26, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is still single and lives with her parents. She is helping them in managing their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Genalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genalyn hopes that her variety store will grow to be a grocery store.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of livestock business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for 11 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a business of making and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Julieta is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional fish for making and selling dried fish.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her business.

loans.name: Palima

texts.en:
Palima is 41 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Palima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, milk, soap, coffee, etc.

Palima has been in this business for three years.

In the future Palima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, milk, soap, coffee, etc

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 42 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school, Noralyn works very hard to provide for them.

Noralyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods like chips, soap, eggs, noodles, spices, etc. to sell.

Noralyn has been in this business for eight years.

In the future Noralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods like chips, soap, eggs, noodles, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
Zoe is 37 years old with one child who is in school. Zoe works very hard to provide for the family.

Zoe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, etc.

Zoe has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Zoe would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a making-and-selling dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fish for her making-and-selling dried fish business.

Rosal has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Rosal has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her business.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money by running a business of sewing and selling clothes in the market.

Phuong would like a loan to purchase better quality sewing materials for her production of clothes. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality sewing materials for her production of clothes.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 58 years old and is married. She has a daughter and a son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a general store at their house for five years. They sell a variety of products to people in their community. She intends to use her loan to buy a great quantity and variety of instant foods, beverages and sauces.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a great quantity and variety of instant foods, beverages and sauces.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu, 42, is married. She has two children and lives with them and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Hieu started a business of sewing clothing eight years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of sewing materials, such as threads and cloth, to stock for her production of clothes to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of sewing materials, such as threads and cloth.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
This charming lady named Anahit lives in Kapan, which is in the Synik region. Anahit is married and has two sons who are still school-aged. Her husband owns a truck on which he transfers people from Yerevan to Kapan, and he also takes private orders. Their family would have very poor living conditions if Anahit would not have her small private business, which is a great help for her husband. She is engaged in a clothes-trading business; she sells newborn babies’ and kids’ clothes of a great variety. She rents a shop in the central part of Kapan city, where everyone already knows her shop pretty well. Anahit and her husband, once in a month, bring a lot of goods from Yerevan wholesale markets in order to keep her shop always full with nice and fashionable puerile clothes. 

Anahit needs the loan amount that she requested for the purchase of seasonal clothes and clothes for children who are attending the school for the first year.

loans.use: to buy a lot of seasonal clothes and clothes for children who are attending the school for the first year in order to add to her income from clothing.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est un Camerounais âgé de 42 ans, marié et sans enfant. il mène une activité de vente de produits alimentaires dans un marché de la ville depuis un an et demi. malgré sa jeunesse dans le domaine il bénéficie d'une clientèle importante. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter un bidon d'huile de palme, les arachides, du riz pour augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. il envisage faire des économies pour se lancer dans la vente d'huile végétale.
texts.en: Daniel is a 42 year old Cameroonian who is married without any children. He has been selling food products in a market in the town for a year and a half. In spite of being inexperienced in this field, he has many clients. With this loan he would like to purchase a can of palm oil, groundnuts, and rice in order to increase his stock and satisfy his clientele. He plans to save up so that he can start a business selling vegetable oil.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gerôme

texts.fr: Gérôme est un jeune homme de 37 ans marié et père de 02 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 03 et 09 ans. il fait dans la vente de la boisson en détail dans un quartier de la place. au regard de la petitesse de son offre,il est confronté à un problème de non satisfaction de sa clientèle. raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter la capacité de boissons. ce qui lui permettra de développer son activité et scolariser ses enfants de même que satisfaire les b esoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gérôme, age 37, is married and the father of two children, aged 3 and 9. He retails beverages in a neighborhood of the city where he lives.

He has trouble satisfying his clientele due to his small product offering. For this reason, he's seeking a loan in order to increase his sales capacity.

This will enable him to develop his business and send his children to school, and also provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to bolster his stock of beverages

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh, 49, is married and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income running a food stall in front of their house. 

He started this business four years ago. He sells noodles to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying better quality foods and furniture to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality foods and furniture to better satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man is 55 years old and is divorced. She lives with her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income by running a laundry shop. 

She started this business six years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of equipment and detergent powder for washing clothes to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of equipment and detergent powder to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Suorng

texts.en:
Suorng is 62 years old, married, and has seven children. She is a resident living in Prey Chor district, from which she operates a farming business. 

She and her husband have good cooperation, helping each other plant cassava on more than half a hectare of farmland. In the harvest season, she can sell the cassava to local traders who come into the village to earn money. As she earns the income from farming, she budgets her income to provide good nutrition for her children and as rolling capital in their businesses. 

Suorng plans to keep developing her farming business in order to make it more feasible and profitable, but she has insufficient capital. That’s why she is borrowing a loan of USD 300 (US dollars) which will be used to prepare the land for planting cassava and to buy farm supplies for her crops, such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She is very pleased to have the loan support from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) and Kiva.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting cassava and to buy farm supplies for her crops, such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jacinta Andrea

texts.es: Jacinta Andrea, 44 años de edad soltera con cinco hijos, de los cuales dos están bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el norte del occidente del país, Jacinta es una persona que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado sacar a delante a sus hijos ya que ella quedo viuda, y se vio en la obligación de buscar por otro lados los ingresos para cubrir los gastos en su hogar es asi como comienza con el negocio de mercadería en general ya que este negocio lo conocía por parte de su esposo que era comerciante actualmente ahora tiene 25 años de manejar esta tienda, ofrece productos como: zapatos de niños, adultos, damas, variedades de ropa de todo tipo, productos plásticos, abanicos, vajillas, entre otros, el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella viaja a otro país a realizar sus compras las cuales son al contado y también viaja  a Managua en algunas ocasiones, ofrece al contado y al crédito sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales, también sale a vender ambulante para captar nuevos clientes, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su pequeña tienda y asi surtir su inventario, uno de sus sueños es ver que sus dos hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera profesional y verlos realizados en la vida.  Jacinta solicita este financiamiento para la compra de mercadería en general como: variedades de ropa, productos plásticos, zapatos entre otros.
texts.en: Jacinta Andrea, who is 44, is a single mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her. She comes from one of the towns in Chinandega department which is in the northwest of the country.  Jacinta is a person who has worked tremendously hard to support her children since she was widowed and was forced to look elsewhere for an income to cover her household expenses.  That was how she came to set up her grocery business; she already knew a bit about it as her husband was a shopkeeper.  She has now been running her shop for 25 years and offers goods such as: children's, adults' and women's shoes, all types of clothing, plastic goods, fans and crockery, among other things.  Her shop is located in her home and she travels to other places to buy her merchandise for cash and, from time to time, also goes to Managua.  She sells her goods for cash and on credit to regular and casual customers and also travels around in search of new customers.  She will use this loan to invest in her small shop and stock up with merchandise.  One of her dreams is to see her two children study for a professional career and lead fulfilling lives.  Jacinta is seeking the loan to buy general merchandise such as: different types of clothing, plastic goods and shoes, among other things.

loans.use: to invest in working capital such as: children's and adult clothing, plastic goods and shoes, among other things

loans.name: Elvis De Jesus

texts.es: Elvis de Jesús 47 años de edad casado con siete hijos, aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona donde predomina la comercialización de mariscos, el turismo por sus hermosas playas, Elvis es propietario de un pequeño acopio de mariscos, el compra a pescadores de la zona y posteriormente los vende a los compradores que entran de otro municipio a parte de los ingresos por venta de mariscos también tiene ingresos de la pesca artesanal, este negocio lo inicia con fondos propios, productos de algunos ahorros personal buscando un medio digno de vida, Elvis con muchos esfuerzos y con créditos que se le han otorgado ha logrado mejorar su vivienda e incrementado su negocio, el objetivo de este crédito  es para capital de trabajo, invertir en variedades de mariscos como: pescados, jaibas, conchas, camarones, tiguacal, langostas entre otros.-
texts.en:
Elvis, 47, is married and has seven children in his care.  He is from a town in Chinandega, an area that is dominated by the shellfish business and tourism because of its beautiful beaches.   Elvis owns a small shellfish collector business and buys fish from the local fishermen.  He then sells to buyers from other towns.  In addition to his shellfish business he also earns a living with artisan fishing.  He started the business with his own capital, which he was able to save in order to seek out a decent lifestyle.

Through much effort and loans he has received, Elvis has been able to renovate his home and increase sales.  This loan will be used as working capital to buy a variety of shellfish such as blue crab, conch, shrimp, Tiguacal crab, lobster, etc.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shellfish.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buying-and-selling vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in her buying-and-selling vegetable business.

Salvacion has been in this business for 16 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lian

texts.en:
Lian is 28 years old and has two children. Lian is married and her two children are in school.

Lian is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lian requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lian has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her  business.

In the future, Lian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers for her flower  growing

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like coffee, sugar, canned goods, cooking oil and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Janet has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, canned goods, cooking oil and other groceries. 

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like coffee, sugar, canned goods, cooking oil and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Maria Elena is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Elena has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Erlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Erlinda works hard to support her family. Ma. Erlinda is married and has businesses of buying and selling medicines and ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

Ma. Erlinda requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Erlinda has been in this business for five years now.

Ma. Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of medicine and ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik is a very young and already very successful businessman. He lives in Ijevan city with his grandfather and grandmother, who are already retired. His parents are in the Russian Federation for abroad work. It is already a year that he has been engaged in the fish selling business, which has brought a good profit to his family. 

With the income of this business, Hovik managed to buy a car for himself and furniture for their kitchen. His grandparents are very proud of their grandson, since he takes care of them properly and perfectly with great love and respect.

Hovik asks a loan from Kiva lenders for the first time and he plans to buy large variety and large amount of fish from fish wholesale markets in order to enlarge both his business and his income from it as well. From the first partnership with Nor Horizon  Hovik has had a practice of paying back the loan amounts properly and on time.

loans.use: To buy a large variety and amount of fish from fish wholesale markets in order to enlarge  his business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 43 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivic has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She offers various goods such as grocery items, cleaning products, etc. She has become popular for providing good quality products at reasonable pricing. 

She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Faida  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  FAIDA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DONGORONA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec ROKIA , 2 eme assise  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group FAIDA Ii are married women who average 35 years of age and five children. They all live in polygamous families in DONGORONA, a village of OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan cycle with the MFI.  

ROKIA grows groundnuts. She appears in the photo sitting second from the left. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing 1 hectare of farmland.

After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the village and in Ouelessebougou to a clientele consisting of consumers and resellers. 

Rokia expects to earn a profit of 175,000FCFA per campaign. This will help her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, and to buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Faida  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  FAIDA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DONGORONA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le gombo  avec  ROKIA ,  assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Faida I group are married women. On average they are 35 years old with six children and live in polygamous familes in Dongorona, one of the villages in Ouelessebougou, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to manage their farming businesses during the winter.
This is their third loan from the institution.
Rokia, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, cultivates gumbo.
With her loan, she plans to buy fertiliser and seeds and to pay for the costs of labouring 0.5 hectares.
She sells the production in the village and in Ouelessebougou after the harvest to her clientele of consumers and retailers.
She hopes to make a profit of 80.000FCFA per exploitation.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labouring costs and to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Djekabara Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  4 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANANZOLE, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le gombo avec  SANATA , debout au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four members of the group DJEKABARA IV are married women who average 30 years of age and four children. They all live in polygamous families in BANANZOLE, a village of OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan cycle with the MFI.  

SANATA grows gumbo. She appears in the photo standing in the middle. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing 0.5 hectare of farmland.

After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the village and in DIALAKOROBA to a clientele consisting of consumers and resellers. 

Sanata expects to earn a profit of 50,000FCFA per campaign. This will help her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, and to buy seeds and inputs.

loans.name: Irania Maria

texts.es: Irania María de 40 años de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, Irania es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora en la vida que ha logrado salir adelante en la vida, es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación el cual ofrece productos de consumo para el hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, bizcotelas, productos de cosméticos como: shampoo,  cremas para el cuerpos, jabones, al igual que productos congelados, golosinas entre otros productos más, Irania tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, los cuales siempre la buscan por su buena atención que ella les brinda a las personas empezando desde el momento que ella abre sus puertas del negocio que es de las 6AM hasta las 10:30PM que ella cierra y si la buscan después de esa hora por emergencia ella con mucho gustos los atiende, inicia su negocio con fondos propios producto de ahorro de su trabajo anterior a parte de ese negocio ella vende comidas los fines de semana lo que le permite tener un ingreso más. El objetivo de este crédito es para reforzar su capital de trabajo e invertir en más en el negocio para que crezca más y en un futuro no muy lejano a remodelar el área de la pulpería, no es primer crédito que está solicitando con nosotros y en los anteriores créditos ha demostrado responsabilidad y buen comportamiento de pago el financiamiento de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo como es la compra de granos básicos, productos congelados entre otros más, debido a que se ha incrementado su demanda. Irania está muy agradecida con los inversionistas Kivas por el apoyo que ellos les ofrecen a personas de países de bajo recursos económicos como es Nicaragua pera tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
Irania María is 40 years old and married, with two minor-aged children. She is from the Chinandega zone in the western part of the country. 

Irania is a hard-working woman and a fighter. This has allowed her to get ahead in life. She is the owner of a small convenience store run out of her home that sells household consumer goods, including rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, bizcotelas (a type of cookie), cosmetic products such as shampoo, body lotion and soap, as well as frozen products, sweets and other items. Irania has both casual and repeat customers that always look for her because of the great service she offers them from the moment she opens the doors at 6 AM, until 10:30 PM when she closes. If they seek her out after that time due to an emergency it is her pleasure to help them. She started her business with her own funds she saved from her previous job. In addition to her business she sells food on weekends, which allows her to have an additional source of income. 

The objective of this loan is to reinforce her working capital, further invest in her business so it continues to grow and to remodel the convenience store area in the not-too-distant future. It is not the first loan she has requested with us and on previous loans she has demonstrated responsibility and good performance on her payments. The funding of the loan is to invest in working capital by purchasing basic grains, frozen products and other items, due to an increase in demand. Irania is very grateful to Kiva investors for the support they offer to people in countries like Nicaragua with few economic resources to have a decent way of life.

loans.use: to purchase consumer goods, increasing her inventory.

loans.name: Sara Raquel

texts.es: Sara Raquel 28 años de edad soltera con un hijo menor de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega, Sara es propietaria de dos tipos negocio uno de ello es la compra venta de mercadería en general el cual compra  en Managua y vende de forma ambulante en mercados a clientes fijos  los cuales sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito donde recupera quincenal surtiendo así a sus clientes con variedades de productos, también es propietaria de un negocio de compra venta de cerdos en pie, el cual inicia su negocio con esfuerzos propios y con la asesoría de su hermana que ya conocía de este tipo de negocio,  ella compra en comarcas aledañas al contado y los vende a comerciantes que entran en la zona, uno de sus sueños es construir su propia casa ya que ella vive en casa de familiares, para así brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo, al igual que verlo realizado como profesional, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en los dos negocios, debido a que ha incrementado su demanda y no posee el suficiente capital para cumplir con sus pedidos.-
texts.en:
Sara Raquel is 28 years old, single and has a young child. She was born in one of the municipalities of northern Chinandega. 

Sara owns two types of businesses. One is buying and selling general merchandise. She buys items in Managua to sell to regular customers in outdoor markets. She provides customers with a variety of products and accepts cash or credit, collecting payments biweekly. 

She also owns a business selling live hogs. She started this business through her own efforts and with the assistance of her sister who was already familiar with this type of business. She buys them from neighbouring regions, paying cash, and sells them to traders who come to the region. 

One of her dreams is to build her own home since she lives in her relative's house, and to give her young son a brighter future. She would also like to see him become a professional. 

This loan will be invested in both businesses, because the demand has increased and she does not have sufficient capital to supply the orders.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise and live hogs.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 25-years-old single man. He lives with his family in a moderate house in Jabalia city. 

Hani works as an employee in a game store in the city and earns a low income. This income barely covers his needs. Hani also studies at the university in the commerce college. He is very insistent to finish his study and take a BA degree and maybe in the future he will complete his study and take a higher degree. 

Hani took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By applying this loan, Hani will be able to do his homework and reports in a better way. This will insure him a better life and job in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Shoruq

texts.en:
Shoruq is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo in their coffee shop.

Shoruq is a 19-year-old single Palestinian woman. She lives with her family in a small village called Dear Ibzee near Ramallah city. Shoruq's father works as a construction worker with a very low wage. 

Shoruq and her brother have a very profitable business, which is a coffee shop that sells soft drinks and light sandwiches. It is in the center of the village and that makes it very crowded at night. Also, it is the only one in the village.
 
Shoruq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to develop the coffee shop by buying more tables and kitchen tools. This will increase the income for the coffee shop and improve the family's living conditions. 

Shoruq would like to take another loan in the future to expand the space of the coffee shop and bring Internet service to the clients.

loans.use: to develop the coffee shop by buying more tables and kitchen tools.

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es: Juana Emilia mayor de edad casada con dos hijos, es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitacion una pulperia en donde ofrece todo tipo de productos desde granos basicos, gaseosas, golosinas cosmeticos entre otros ella realiza sus compras al contado en camiones distribuidores, sus ventas son al contado y en ocasiones al credito aunque son muy pocos y los recupera cada 15 y 30 de cada mes, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de reparar su vivienda y asi ofrecerles un techo digno donde vivir a sus hijos, el objetivo de este credito es para invertir en capital de trabajo incrementando su invetario y asi ofrecerles nuevos y mejores productos a sus clientes ya que su demanda ha crecido arduarmente. Juana agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas ofrecen a personas de bajos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Juana Emilia is married and has two children.  She is a small business owner and runs a grocery store out of her house where she sells all kinds of staple goods, sodas, sweets, cosmetics, etc.  She buys the merchandise in cash from a distributor truck and sells on both a cash and occasional credit basis; although in the latter case she collects payment every 15 and 30 days.  Her customers are both fixed and eventual.  One of her goals is to finish renovating her house so her children can have a decent roof over their heads.  The loan will be used as working capital to increase store inventory and offer new and better products.  This is due to the strong increase in customer demand.

Juana is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders are giving to people with low incomes.

loans.use: To buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, beans, detergents, frozen products, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lizz

texts.en:
Lizz is a widow aged 43 years old and she has three children aged between 18 and 10 years old.  She is a dairy farmer and supplies milk to nearby customers for resale.  She has been in the farm for a period of three years, earning herself a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is now requesting her second loan of Kes 60,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase her milk supply.  The profits she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children who are in school.

Her dream is see that she prospers in her farm and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Weinberger

texts.es: Weinberger 25 años de edad, soltero, del municipio de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por el comercio, ubicado en el occidente del país, Weinberger  es propietario de ganado, como son vacas paridas productoras de leche. Se dedica a la venta de leche, joven que inicio su negocio hace cuatro años,  empezó con fondos propios y con ayuda de sus padres, actualmente ya es independiente en este negocio, lo cual ayuda a sus padres y hermano.  El es un joven emprendedor y muy esforzado a diario ordeña sus vacas las que le generan veinticinco litros de leche a diario y  la vende de manera ambulante, adicional tiene otros ingresos como docente en un colegio.  Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar una vaca parida, la cual está produciendo bastante leche y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Weinberger, 25, is single and lives in the town of Chinandega, known for its commerce and located in the western part of the country.  Weinberger has a dairy cattle ranch and sells milk for a living, a business he started four years ago with his own money and help from his parents.  Currently, he runs his business independently which helps his parents and brother.  

This young entrepreneur works very hard every day milking his cows to obtain 25 liters of milk daily which he sells as a street vendor.  He also works as a school teacher to make extra income.  He is requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow so he can produce enough milk to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 59-year-old married woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. 

She is engaged in a food-vending business, selling various home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Paula is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, milk and baking soda and fertilizer for the farm. With this, Paula believes that she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and baking soda and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 33-year-old married mother of two children. For the last three years, she has been selling fish in Malindi, earning a monthly profit of KES 6,750.

Joyce, who was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, is applying for her second loan of KES 15,000 to buy additional fish to sell. She will use the profits arising from this loan to pay school fees for her children and expand her business. Her future goals are to continue with her enterprise and possibly own a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to resell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
This is Pablita. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business but also in her family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like bags, umbrellas, towels, bed sheets and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pablita dreams of being successful in her business and hopes to be closer to God. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like bags, umbrellas, towels, bed sheets, etc

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
This is Lina. She previously accessed an 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big boost for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lina hopes to have more customers and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth, who is married, works hard to support her family. For two years now she has operated a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Maribeth has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs, and in the future hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana operates a food stall business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Violet from Bulawayo. She is married and has five children. Four of their children are in primary school and one in secondary school.  

Violet runs a retail business selling fresh and dried fish and kapenta (sardines). The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges she faces are transport costs and health tariffs. 

Violet has requested a loan of $500 to buy bulk stocks of kapenta and fish for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to supplement her spouse's salary and improve her business capacity as well as their lifestyle. 

In the future Violet plans to venture into the poultry business.

loans.use: to buy bulk dried kapenta and fish for resale.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is a married Iraqi client, who is 43 years old, married and has three children. Kasem and one of his children take care of providing the family income.

Kasem owns a small shop where he sells car accessories and where he also tailors covers for car seats. He established his business in 2010 and now he has a hired employee. Kasem grew fast in this field and he is being well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Kasem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to pay the annual rent of his shop as well as to increase his inventory. Kasem is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop as well as to increase his inventory to manufacture car seat covers

loans.name: Djekabara Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKABARA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANANZOLE, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  KIATOU , 1 ère assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djekabara III group are married women. On average they are 45 years old with six children and live in polygamous families in Bananzole, one of the villages in Ouelessebougou, the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to manage their farming businesses during the winter.
This is their fifth loan from the institution.
Kiatou, who is sitting first from left towards the right in the photo, cultivates rice.
With her loan, she plans to buy fertiliser and seeds and to pay for the costs of labouring 1 hectare.
After harvesting she sells the production in the village and in Dialakoroba to her clientele of consumers and retailers.
She hopes to make a profit of 125.000FCFA per exploitation.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labouring costs, and the purchase of seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto de 60 años de edad, soltero y originario del municipio de Chinandega, es propietario de un negocio de comidas y refrescos naturales, donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos en variedad de estilos de platillos con diferentes sabores de refrescos, también ofrece mercadería en general, ropa y cosméticos. Posee clientes fijos como son los transportistas que conducen el servicio de taxis, triciclos, camiones y cuenta también con clientes eventuales, sus ventas son de contado y también al crédito y lo recupera semanal y quincenalmente. Solicita crédito, para capital de trabajo, ya que necesita invertir más en ambos negocios y así cubrir las necesidades demandadas por sus clientes. Mario expresa que está muy agradecido y satisfecho con los inversionistas Kiva, por el apoyo que le dan a personas de escasos recursos económicos y  así  poder adquirir un préstamo, para invertir más en los negocios y tener una mejor manera de vivir.
texts.en: Mario Alberto, who is a single man of 60, comes from the town of Chinandega.  He owns a food and natural fruit juice business, where he serves breakfast and lunch (consisting of a range of different types of dish and various flavours of drinks) and also stocks groceries, clothing and cosmetics. He has both regular customers, such as taxi, tricycle and lorry drivers, and casual customers. He sells his goods for cash and on credit and collects payments weekly and fortnightly.  He is seeking a working capital loan because he needs to invest more in both businesses, which will enable him to meet the needs and requirements of this customers.  Mario tells us that he is very grateful and delighted with Kiva investors for enabling economically disadvantaged people to get loans to invest further in their businesses and have a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, bags, fruit and other products he needs to make the food that he sells

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
SOUTOURA est un groupe de l’association MINATATON de KELEYA. Il regroupe  5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, cinq enfants et  mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de riz à l’image de MOH  qui est la deuxième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KELEYA dans la  préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
MOH, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KELEYA, excelle dans la vente de riz. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelques sacs de riz.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnant et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend son riz  à KELEYA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
SOUTOURA is a group from the association MINATATON de KELEYA. It comprises five women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 38 years of age and five children each, and they have different businesses, such as trading in condiments and rice, just like MOH, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in KELEYA, in Préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are in high demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their ninth solidarity loan.
 
MOH, who is the group's president, is well-known in KELEYA and excels at selling rice. She intends to use her loan to purchase a few sacks of rice. She gets her supplies from the surrounding villages and locally from wholesalers, and she sells her rice, cash or credit, in KELEYA at the retail level. Her customer base is composed of men and women. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA enabling her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es: Corina del Carmen de 48 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos, ambos estudiantes y del municipio de Chinandega, posee cuatro negocios el primero es una pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos básicos para el consumo esencial del hogar, cosméticos, ropa, golosinas y prendas, el segundo  negocio que también administra es el servicio de alquiler de sillas, mesas, manteles, para todo tipo de eventos sociales, el tercer negocio es el servicio de juegos de nintendos y el cuarto negocio es la venta de gas butano.  Corina empezó su negocio con ventas de frutas y golosinas en su casa de habitación y luego creo la idea de establecer su propia pulpería y así poco a poco y con financiamientos ha ido mejorando su estilo de vida, ya tiene dieciséis años de tener su negocio y  es una mujer de visión, luchadora, esforzada y sobre todo muy creativa, para ir estableciendo sus negocios y así poder terminar de preparar a sus hijos, suplir todas las necesidades del hogar y obtener mejores ingresos en la familia. Corina está solicitando un financiamiento para capital de trabajo, ya que necesita invertir más en la pulpería, abasteciéndose en gran cantidad en granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa para niños, damas y caballero, entre otros. Corina está muy agradecida con los inversionistas, ya que le han dado la oportunidad de adquirir préstamos y de esta manera surtir, crecer e implementar sus negocios, para mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Corina del Carmen is 48 years old, single, and has two children, who are students. She lives in the Chinandega municipality. 

She owns four businesses. The first is a general store that offers all types of basic products for household use, like cosmetics, clothing, snacks, and garments. The second business that she runs is a store that rents chairs, tables, and tablecloths for all types of social events. The third business sells Nintendo video games, and the fourth sells butane gas.

Corina began her business by selling fruit and snacks in her home, and later got the idea to establish her own general store. Little by little, and with loans, she has been improving her quality of life. 

She has owned her business for 16 years. She is a woman with a vision, determined, strong, and above all very creative, to have established her businesses, raised her children, supplied all of the household necessities, and provided her family with better income.

Corina requests a loan for working capital so that she can invest more in the general store and stock a large quantity of staple grains, cosmetics, clothing for men, women, and children, and other things.

Corina is very grateful to those who loan money to her, since they have given her the opportunity to acquire loans and stock, grow, and implement her businesses and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in more products for her general store, like staple grains, cosmetics, and clothing for children, men, and women.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline's tenth loan cycle. She uses all her loans as additional capital for her business. Her income from the loan helped her in sending her children to school as well as in their everyday expenses. Since she is the only one raising her children, she is working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also sells frozen and processed foods for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.
